# Background

Your Cuban uncle sets up a cocktail bar in downtown Budapest. He has a secret list of cocktails that he would like to serve in the bar. He asks you to do create a few lists and tables to set up the shop. As your uncle is a secret hipster, he has a dataset on Github that you can use for the task!

## 1. Read the data

Read the cocktail dataset from: <https://github.com/nthun/cocktail-balance> You can also find the codebook there.

```{r} #5 perc eltelt míg rájöttem hogy nem csv 
cocktail_raw <- read_tsv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nthun/cocktail-balance/refs/heads/master/cocktail_data.tsv")

```         

## 2. Transform the data table and clean the ingredient variable!

The ingredients are currently in a single cell for each cocktail. It would be better to put them in separate rows. Also, the variable should be cleaned of all quantities (e.g. 1/2 oz, 2 dashes, etc.), and the indicator of alcohol content (e.g. 47.3% abv). You will need to use this cleaned table in later tasks.

```{r} #az abv érézkeny téma az összetevőknél, nem mindegy hogy 37% rum vagy 82% rum kerül a koktélba, de kiszedem.
#létrehozunk egy változót a tisztított hozzávalóknak és megkezdjük a felesleges elemek eltávolítását
ingredients_clean <- cocktail_raw %>%
  select(name, ingredients) %>% 
  separate_rows(ingredients, sep = ", ") %>%
  mutate(
  ingredients_clean = ingredients %>%  
    #számokat kiszedjük
    str_remove_all("[0-9]") %>%
    #breaket átíruk vesszővé 
    str_replace_all("<br/>", ",") %>%
    str_replace_all("<br>", ",") %>%
    #kiszedünk minden szimbólumot, de az előbb kreált vesszők maradnak
    str_remove_all("[[:punct:]&&[^,]]") %>%
    #megpróbálom kiszedni az összes lehető mértékegységet amit mixologyban használnak
    str_remove_all("\\b(ml|mL|cl|l|L|dl|oz|fl oz|tsp|tbsp|bsp|dash|dashes|drop|drops|sprig|sprigs|splash|splashes|pinch|pinches|barspoon|bar spoon|bar-spoon|shot|shots|jigger|pony|cup|cups|abv|)\\b") %>%
    #kiszedjük a fölös leíró szavakat, syrup fajták maradnak (pl. simple,), de a "facsart"/"leheletnyi" repül
    str_remove_all("\\b(fresh|optional|garnish|for|to|taste|rim|twist|wedge|wheel|slice|peeled|zest|organic|large|small|cube|cubes|crushed|centifuged|Centrifuged|clarified|centrifugeclarified|agarclarified)\\b") %>%
    str_squish()%>%
    str_replace_all("\\s*,\\s*", ", ")
  )

  #raw ingredients column nem kell többé
  ingredients_clean$ingredients <- NULL
# na s most akkor tidy formatba próbáljuk tenni 
tidy_ingredients <- ingredients_clean %>%
separate_rows(ingredients_clean, sep = ",\\s*") %>%
  mutate(ingredients_clean = str_squish(ingredients_clean)) %>% group_by(name) %>%
  mutate(ingredient_no = row_number()) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  pivot_wider(id_cols = name,
  names_from = ingredient_no,
  values_from = ingredients_clean,
  names_prefix = "ingredient_")

# ez így megfelelőnek túnik, bár van egy halom NA a sorokban...rm.na?



```

## 3. All ingredients in alphabetical order

Before opening the bar, you need to find a reliable supplier that has all the ingredients. You need to send a list of all possible ingredients you will need. They don't need the quantities (i.e. how many of these are needed), just the names of the ingredients.

```{r}

vimpex_rendeles <- ingredients_clean %>%
separate_rows(ingredients_clean, sep = ",\\s*") %>%
# itt lowercasere állítok mindent, mert másképp újrakezdi az ABC-t az uppercase W után lowercase a-tól kezdődik megint
mutate(ingredients_clean = str_to_lower(ingredients_clean)) %>%
distinct(ingredients_clean) %>%
arrange(ingredients_clean)


```

How many different ingredients you will need?

```{r}
count(vimpex_rendeles) #59 összetevő kell
```

## 10. Create a cheat sheet for the bartender!

Create a matrix that shows all cocktail names as rows and all ingredients as columns. When a cocktail requires an ingredient, there should be an "X" in the cell, otherwise, the cell should remain empty. Example:

```{r echo=FALSE}
tribble(~name, ~Lime, ~`White rum`, ~`Cane sugar`, ~`Coca-cola`, ~Mint, ~Soda,
        "Caipirissima", "X", "X", "X", "", "", "",
        "Cuba Libre", "X", "X", "", "X","","",
        "Mojito", "X", "X", "", "", "X", "X") %>% 
    relocate(name, sort(names(.)))
```
